JAVA links All important software systems evolve, but over time entropy causes structural rot. Refactoring instills efficiency to the internal structure of a system and refactoring can restore evolving software to vibrant health. Manual refactoring can be an involved process, hence use of RefactorIT, the world's fastest and easiest automated way to refactor Java systems can save you considerable time, effort, and financial resources. PDF links ADOBE: ADOBE SYSTEMS INC. Quite Software: The home of Aandi Inston, PDF expert Ghostscript: a suite of free PDF tools Planet PDF: A comprehensive, popular and independent Web site exclusively focused on Adobe Acrobat/PDF users and uses. Planet PDF also incorporates Planet PDF Forum and Planet PDF Store. PDF Zone The online authority for Acrobat, PDF and Document Management Professionals. JPedal: a 100% Java library designed to ease the integration of pdf files into any workflow. concentrating on the easy display, manipulation and extraction of content. PangoPDF: a PDF backend for Pango for creating PDF output (using PDFLib). PDF/X: PDF/X is not an alternative to PDF, itâ€™s a focused subset of PDF designed specifically for reliable prepress data interchange. xmlroff: an XSL formatter written in C that produces PDF and PostScript. PdfTeX: pdfTeX (by Han The Thanh) is a TeX variant that can generate PDF output directly instead of dvi. PDFBox: PDFBox is a Java PDF Library. This project will allow access to all of the components in a PDF document. Doc2pdf: Doc2pdf is an email robot that converts Microsoft Office attachments (.doc, .ppt, and .xls) to PDF. gnujpdf: a Java package (gnu.jpdf.*) licensed under the LGPL. It provides a simple API to create pdf files and print using subclasses of java.awt.Graphics and java.awt.PrintJob Apache FOP: the world's first print formatter driven by XSL formatting objects (XSL-FO) and the world's first output independent formatter. PDFill Form Filler: iText makes it possible to come up with a PDF Form Filler at only $9.99. This form filler allows you to fill PDF form fields, insert formatted text, check box, image, URL, whiteout and blank page without Adobe Acrobat. The edited file can be saved locally for email and archiving with options of password, information and view preference. The filling can be stopped now and resumed later. It has Spell-Checker for the filled texts and Smart Positioning for accurate alignment.
Reporting tools JasperReports: a powerful open source Java reporting tool that has the ability to deliver rich content onto the screen, to the printer or into PDF, HTML, XLS, CSV and XML files. JFreeReport: a free Java report library (using iText for PDF output). UJAC: UJAC provides a collection of JAVA components which may be useful in some projects. (Improved XML to PDF using iText included.) reportman: Report manager is a reporting application (Report Manager Designer) and also a set of components for Delphi , Builder and Kylix, also supports development environment accepting ActiveX controls (Visual Basic,Visual FoxPro,any Visual Studio.Net language...), also a C dynamic standard library with exported functions is provided to use the engine with any other language like GNU C. TagPrint: a DOM serialization library. It prints DOM documents with various format, such as XML, HTML, PDF, RTF, etc... You can write these documents very easily. Datavision: an Open Source reporting tool similar to Crystal Reports.
